intro: Corydalis bulbilligera, commonly known as the clustered corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The flowers are typically pink or purple, with two lower petals that are spurred at the base. The plant produces small, rounded seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its propagation. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and woodland settings.
